intro: Sloanea anoriensis, commonly known as the Anoriensis Sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Sloanea anoriensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within montane forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
